verses.text: 大衛驚聞掃羅父子的死訊掃羅死後，大衛殺退了亞瑪力人回來，就在洗革拉住了兩天。

words.note: Often used for news that causes alarm.
Verb-complement compound indicating successful repulsion.

verses.text: 第三天，忽然有一個人從掃羅的營回來，衣服撕裂，頭上蒙灰。這人一來到大衛面前，就俯伏在地上叩拜他。

words.note: A sign of mourning or repentance in biblical culture.
Used in the '一...就...' construction to mean 'as soon as...then...'
Often pairs with '一' to mean 'as soon as...then...'
Indicates deep reverence or submission.
Implies a gesture of deep respect or adoration.

verses.text: 大衛問他：「你從哪裡來？」他對他說：「我是從以色列的營中逃出來的。」

words.note: Verb-complement compound, indicating movement out of a place.

verses.text: 大衛又問他：「情況怎麼樣？請你告訴我！」他回答：「眾人都逃離戰場，他們中間不但有許多人倒地陣亡，連掃羅和他的兒子約拿單也死了。」

words.note: Specifically refers to death during warfare.
Used to emphasize an extreme case.

verses.text: 於是，大衛問那向他報信的年輕人：「你怎麼知道掃羅和他的兒子死了呢？」

words.note: More formal than '所以' (suǒyǐ) for 'so'.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to deliver news'.
Turns the preceding phrase into an adjective modifying the following noun.
Softens a question or implies a situation.

verses.text: 那個向大衛報信的年輕人回答：「我剛巧在基利波山，看見掃羅靠在自己的矛槍上，又見有戰車和馬兵緊緊地追趕他。
他回頭看到我，就呼喚我。我說：『我在這裡。』
他問我：『你是誰？』我回答他：『我是亞瑪力人。』

words.note: A descendant of Esau, enemy of Israel.

verses.text: 於是他對我說：『請你站到我身邊來，把我殺死，因為痛苦抓住我，我卻還死不了。』
我就站到他身邊去，把他殺了，因為我知道他一倒下，就不能再活了。我摘下他頭上的王冠，取下他臂上的手鐲，帶到這裡來奉給我主。」

words.note: Refers to a king's crown, often symbolic in biblical context.
Likely a royal armlet/regalia in this context, not common fashion jewelry.
A formal term, often used for presenting to a superior or deity.
Here refers to David as 'my lord' or 'my master'.

verses.text: 大衛就抓住自己的衣服，把它們全都撕裂。所有與他在一起的人也都是這樣。

words.note: Often refers to tearing clothes as a sign of grief or distress.

verses.text: 他們為了掃羅、他的兒子約拿單、耶和華的子民和以色列家的緣故悲哀、哭泣、禁食直到晚上，因為他們已經倒斃在刀下。

words.note: Often refers to God's chosen people in biblical texts.
Here, 'house of Israel' refers to the people of Israel.
To abstain from food, typically for religious reasons.
Often refers to death in battle or sudden demise.

verses.text: 報信者死大衛問那向他報信的年輕人：「你是哪裡的人？」他回答：「我是個寄居這地的亞瑪力人的兒子。」

words.note: Literally 'one who reports news'.
To live temporarily in a foreign place.

verses.text: 大衛對他說：「你伸手毀滅耶和華的受膏者，怎麼還不懼怕呢？」

words.note: A person consecrated for a special office by anointing with oil.

verses.text: 於是大衛叫了一個年輕人來，說：「你上前去，砍倒他。」那年輕人擊殺他，他就死了。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for killing in battle or execution.

verses.text: 大衛對他說：「你流人血的罪要歸到自己的頭上，因為你親口作證指控自己說：『我殺了耶和華的受膏者。』」

words.note: A verb-object phrase meaning 'shed blood of humans'.
了 indicates completion of the action.
The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to a king or priest consecrated by anointing.

verses.text: 大衛為掃羅和約拿單作哀歌大衛為掃羅和他的兒子約拿單作了這首哀歌。

words.note: A song of sorrow or mourning.
了 indicates completion of the action.

verses.text: 他又吩咐要把這首「弓歌」教導猶大人。（這首歌記錄在《雅煞珥書》上。）

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb.
A song named after the bow, associated with warfare.
An ancient non-canonical Hebrew book mentioned in the Bible.
Used as a positional suffix meaning 'on' or 'in'.

verses.text: 「以色列啊！尊榮的人都在高處被殺，勇士怎麼都已仆倒！

words.note: Indicates surprise, admiration, or a plea.
被 indicates passive voice.
Often used in archaic or literary contexts.

verses.text: 你們不要在迦特報道，不要在亞實基倫的街上宣揚，免得非利士的女子歡喜，免得未受割禮之人的女子快樂。

words.note: Lit. 'not received circumcision ritual'.
之 is an archaic possessive/modifying particle.

verses.text: 基利波的群山啊！願雨露都不降在你們上面，願你們的田地不產供物。因為勇士的盾牌在那裡玷污，掃羅的盾牌沒有用油抹亮。

words.note: Refers to religious offerings.

verses.text: 不見被殺者的血、勇士的脂油，約拿單的弓不縮回，掃羅的劍也不空空返回。

words.note: Implies 'not to be found'.
Refers to the choicest part of an animal, often for sacrifice.
Implies the bow was always used, never put away unused.
Here, implies 'without effect' or 'without bloodshed'.

verses.text: 掃羅和約拿單，生時相親相愛，死時也不分離。他們比鷹還快速，比獅子更勇猛。

words.note: An idiom describing deep mutual affection.

verses.text: 以色列的女子啊！你們要為掃羅哭泣，他曾給你們穿上紫色豪華的衣服，又給你們的外衣加上金飾。
勇士怎麼會在戰陣上倒斃，約拿單在高處被刺死！

words.note: Here, indicating possibility or unexpectedness.
Functions as a locative suffix here.
Often used for dying in battle or disaster.

verses.text: 我的兄弟約拿單啊！我為你悲痛，你是我最好的朋友，你對我的愛情遠超過婦女的愛情。

words.note: Here meaning 'far surpass', indicating a great degree.

verses.text: 勇士怎麼會倒斃！爭戰的武器怎麼會毀滅！」

words.note: Indicates possibility or likelihood.
A more literary or formal term for 'die'.
Often used in religious or historical contexts.
Indicates possibility or likelihood.
